title: A Giant Vocal Cord Polyp Mimics Asthma Attack
patient: A 38-year-old Japanese housewife who was a heavy smoker was admitted to our hospital because of upper respiratory distress that developed half a year prior to admission. She had no past medical history. On admission, her vital signs were normal. Physical examination showed hoarseness, stridor, wheezing, and orthopnoea, but no swelling of the tonsils, thyroid, or lymph nodes. A computed tomography of the neck revealed an enlarged tumor ().
